programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When an officer's body camera malfunctions during an altercation, Frank is faced with public backlash; Baez and Danny step in when a witness is denied protection by the U.S. Marshals Service; Erin looks into a rape claim made by a friend's daughter.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When three prominent community leaders are murdered, they seem to be casualties of hate crimes; after being mugged, Linda decides to carry a gun.

programme.desc: Frank looks for evidence against a suspected cop killer; Danny and Baez investigate the murders of stars of adult films.

programme.desc: When a group of highly trained Army veterans robs a bank, Danny feels conflicted; a street artist is responsible for a bomb scare in a subway.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A homeless teenager claims his aunt was murdered by her boyfriend; Erin is replaced on a case involving a corrections officer.

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.desc: Erin must bring a mob informant back to New York to help with a case after losing her star witness; Frank and Mayor Poole debate about police officer benefits.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will are unwitting accomplices in a bookmaking operation when a bookie hides his day's collections in their truck.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy is reunited with her ex-husband, Ethan McKinley - who embezzled millions in Katrina relief funds - after he's tied to the murder of a crime boss' son.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A deadly accident at a naval base exposes a unit of Seabees to a super virus and leaves the rest of the base and the city of New Orleans at risk for an outbreak; Wade is infected with the virus and given hours to live.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lasalle must investigate his former partner in the Vice unit after the NCIS team finds a link between an international drug ring and the New Orleans Police Department; Rita looks into a connection between the mayor and illegal activity in Clearwater.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: Altamont
programme.desc: Comedian Jay Mohr tackles subjects from unexpected visitors, bringing up children to working with Chris Farley on SNL in his new stand-up special.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: American Treasure
programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: I Can Laugh About It Now
programme.desc: The comedian discusses his life’s difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.desc: The winner of Last Comic Standing discusses the obvious questions people ask him, misunderstandings about being a disabled person, and more.

programme.desc: The Emmy-winning stand-up, producer, writer, and author tickles funnybones as he recounts his bumpy transition from manhood to parenthood.

programme.title: Mark Evans: Southern, Not Stupid
programme.desc: Mark's here to relay the stupidity of humanity. Among his claims are that Miss Piggy is alive and well and indoor plumbing is accessible in the South.

programme.title: Joe Devito: First of All
programme.desc: Joe DeVito's dead-on timing and unexpected twists have landed him appearances on the Late Late Show, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central and more.

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny
programme.desc: Jenny McCarthy’s brand of naughty comedy gets a boost from popular female comedians, including Tiffany Haddish, on the realities of being a woman.

programme.title: Keith Stubbs: Poundcake
programme.desc: Triple threat in comedy, acting, and DJing, Keith Stubbs brings his suburban gangster persona “Pound Cake” to the stage before a live audience.

programme.title: Kevin Nealon: Whelmed, But Not Overly
programme.desc: With his unique sense of humor, profound dry wit, and likeable demeanor, Kevin Nealon brings his jazzy cool style to “Whelmed… But Not Overly.” He's like a big kid as he delights in stories of messing with celebrities and embarrassing moments.

programme.title: Sasheer Zamata: Pizza Mind
programme.desc: Sasheer ZamataÍs "Pizza Mind" will give viewers food for thought. In this all-new stand-up special, Sasheer covers a spectrum of topics, from drugs to relationships, Disney racism to politics _ nothing is off limits. This multi-talented comedian incorporates different performance elements to express her opinions and dive into her personal life, truly giving you a piece of her mind.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: Champion
programme.desc: Indomitable Steve Byrne brings the high-energy flair that earned him a nod as one of the best comics in the history of the Comedy Central Standup.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: Tell the Damn Joke
programme.desc: The comic brings his signature style to Chicago with an all-new comedy special that holds no punches, calls it like it is, and tells the damn jokes.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: The Byrne Identity
programme.desc: Comedian Steve Byrne, who has established himself as one of the premier stand-up comedians of his generation, delivers a new stand-up set.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: The Last Late Night
programme.desc: A veteran comedian bucks the traditional stand-up special format by delivering a sixty-minute set on his own late-night talk show.

programme.title: Zoltan Kaszas: Cat Jokes
programme.desc: Born in Budapest, Hungary and raised in San Diego, California, this comic first stepped onstage at the age of 19 and was hooked immediately.

programme.title: Aaron Karo: The Rest Is History
programme.desc: In his first one-hour stand-up special, funnyman Aaron Karo raises the comedy bar as he uncorks his witty observations on bridesmaids' speeches, tanked-up friends who always start fights and the perils of being a 30-year-old bachelor.

programme.title: Alice Wetterlund: My Mama Is a Human and So Am I
programme.desc: The comic and actress discusses her difficulties raising cats, struggling with alcoholism, and her surprising and hilarious alien conspiracy.

programme.title: Aries Spears: Comedy Blueprint
programme.desc: The MADTV alum takes the stage in Philadelphia to deliver jokes and impressions, where no one is spared from his ferociously aggressive comic style.

programme.title: Armando Anto: The Maestro of Comedy
programme.desc: The comedian has an unusual set of skills including classical violin mastery, guitar playing, breakdancing, and working with untalented kids.

programme.title: Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
programme.desc: Reflecting a 1980’s sensibility from a long career, Bobby Slayton has honed his stage presence as a no-nonsense, world-weary stand-up comic.

programme.title: Bob Stromberg: I'm a Pretty Big Deal
programme.desc: After forty years performing a blend of stand-up, story, and shtick, Bob Stromberg brings his style to the trials of aging.

programme.title: Brian Aylward: Big in Asia
programme.desc: The Canadian comic performs in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, where he uses his first stand-up comedy special to discuss his adventures in Asia.

programme.title: Cara Connors: Straight for Pay
programme.desc: Connors delivers an exuberant hour of full-body laughs and plenty of thought-provoking material in her breakout debut comedy special.

programme.desc: The upbeat comedian discusses her secrets to a long marriage, the difference between love and like, and more in this hilarious stand up special.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Inflamed by Kate's comment that he's only "nouveau smart", Charlie starts covertly dating a brilliant coffee-shop barista. The only problem is that the woman is turned on by sex where there's a chance of getting caught -- and she's Kate's patient.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Charlie and his ex, Jennifer, are having an issue with how Charlie still tries to manage her life when Cleo - one of Charlie’s patients from his prison anger therapy group – shows up on his doorstep, fresh out on parole. Jennifer decides to get back at Charlie by dating the ex-con.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Charlie has to evaluate the depth of his involvement in his patient's lives when he accidentally helps his patient who vicariously enjoys other people's anger hook up with a crazy woman.

programme.desc: After Charlie and Kate have sex, he innocently asks her if she wants to go to a movie. programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A cabdriver develops chest pains and seizures; a hotel manager is found dead on the steps of his apartment.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's an early Sunday morning when a local resident decides to take a short-cut through the church parking lot. Walking past a lone car, the resident can't believe his eyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train passenger behaves oddly en route to Arizona and then disappears. The next day his bloodied body is found in Texas. Dr. G attempts to piece together this bizarre tragedy.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 94-year-old woman dies in the hospital after having a convulsion. The case becomes the business of the medical examiner's office when no one will sign her death certificate.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G preforms an autopsy on an alleged hit-and-run victim but finds no evidence of vehicular injury on the 41-year-old man's body. Could his alcoholism have had a role in his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It is 3am and Deputy Torres is cruising a Texas highway when he suddenly spots a crushed pick-up truck along the side of the road. Trapped inside is the lifeless body of 24-year-old Luis Reyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired military officer is found dead in his own backyard during a freak ice storm in San Antonio, Texas.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A healthy 53-year-old woman is found dead in bed. After performing an autopsy and taking blood and tissue samples, Dr. G cannot find the cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Ricky Hawthorne, a middle-aged man with a history of AIDS, arrives at his local hospital complaining of chest pains. Doctors perform extensive tests on him but find nothing wrong and release him.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Recent college grad Robert Terrible is out drinking at a club with friends celebrating. At 3am, he realizes he better call it a night and heads to the nearby garage where he parked his car.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A decomposing body is found in a pond and a tent is found nearby. Dr. G performs the autopsy in the morgue but finds few clues other than fingerprints and mouthwash in the stomach.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An 82-year-old woman appears to have committed suicide by overdosing on painkillers, but Dr. G finds evidence that suggests that she may have died of a heart attack.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Amanda Reese breaks out in hives and begins to hyperventilate after returning from a Hurricane Katrina relief effort. Dr. G wonders if an infection caused this young woman's untimely death.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Odion tries to get the good Marik to resist his evil half. As a result, Yami Marik becomes angered, and attacks Odion with the Millennium Rod, which weakens Odion even more. Odion doesn't give up, despite Ishizu's protests. As Marik continues his onslaught (which begins to injure Odion), Odion tells Marik's good side that together, they had conquered his evil half before, and that they could do it again. Then, he tells the good Marik that since Yami Marik was created by the good Marik's hatred, he has the power to destroy him. As Yami Marik raises the Rod to deliver the final blow, the good Marik disappears from the field, and begins fighting against Yami Marik, who struggles for control over Marik's body, and refuses to be defeated. However, Marik's good half stalls Yami Marik long enough for Yugi to activate his spell card. Yugi's Ragnarok spell succeeds in destroying (and removing to the graveyard) Ra, allowing the good Marik to regain control of his body. However, a sliver of Yami Marik reappears on the field, although this time, he is the victim. Yami Marik tries to convince the good Marik to help him seize the Millennium Items and rule the world together, but fails as Marik has decided to stop being evil and make up for his actions. Marik surrenders the duel to Yugi, which sends Yami Marik to the Shadow Realm, ending the Battle City finals. Bakura and Mai are returned from the shadow realm and Marik is reunited with his siblings, who forgive him. Yugi receives the three Egyptian God Cards. Kaiba then activates the Duel Tower's self-destruct sequence, giving everybody one hour to get off the island before it explodes.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty checks the progress of the potatoes he planted earlier in the year and recommends plants for dry shade under trees.We travel to Somerset to get water saving tips from a water scientist who uses a variety of techniques to save as much water as possible in her own garden and we meet a gardener who has filled his home with over one thousand houseplants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the gardening year gets underway at Longmeadow, Monty is tidying up his ornamental grass border, pruning roses and planning for summer scent. Joe Swift continues his series on trees when he gives tips for how to plant a tree for future success.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts a new project, a cutting garden, and gives advice on what to grow to provide plenty of cut flowers for gorgeous summer bouquets. We visit Cumbria to meet Jack Gott, who has been passionate about that most flamboyant of flowers, the dahlia, for more than forty years and has over a thousand plants in his garden; and James Alexander-Sinclair celebrates a harbinger of Spring, the ephemeral cherry blossom, at Alnwick Castle in Northumberland.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With warmer days just around the corner, Adam Frost takes stock of his borders and plans ahead for some year-round interest. He also adds some soft fruit to his veg garden and gets some seed sowing underway.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch he’s helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed “Buddy.”

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Justin Miller deployed to Iraq twice in his Army career, when he returned home he faced a new battle; Post Traumatic Stress. Justin has his own personal battles with PTS, but he has now found a way to help countless more veterans in their battle through an organization he co-founded called Operation Objective Zero.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It has been a hell of a week in Mexico but the guys aren't done yet. They still have some time to lay some critters down!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isn’t all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: When temperatures plummet and the landscape is buried in snow, the whitetail deer’s true resilience is put to the test.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi and friend, Rob Shaw hunt whitetails with their bows with Phire Creek Outdoors. They both hope Phire Creek and Kansas live up to their reputations of big whitetail bucks.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi and Chris have hunted NM for years with some success each year. This year they include two new friends, Nick Ventura and his dad. They receive rain like they never had before and when they finally make it out to hunt, Willi is hoping to connect.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Atlanta Braves 3rd baseman Austin Riley trades the baseball diamond for the wide-open west as he joins Tyler Jordan in Montana on an epic whitetail bow hunt. It's the ultimate game of cat and mouse as Austin and Tyler try to get a monster buck in bow range.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Big 8 Shows up once again in front of Pitts, will he be able to get a shot this time or will the deer give him the slip for the 4th day in a row.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: We are in Kansas again chasing monster whitetails. This season makes 15 years that we have been going to Kansas and this year was special. But first we had to show you this amazing listing in South Louisiana that’s a little different for the Hunting Land Man.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins a local legend in the waters of Amelia Island, exploring its rich fishery and targeting redfish, trout, and more in this coastal gem.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins Capt. Ozzie in Captiva, FL where the action is fast and furious and they chase down an inshore slam in this beautiful Florida fishery.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Capt. Glenn Taylor fish their home waters and pay tribute to dear friend Capt. Billy Nobles.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Sportsmans Journal
programme.desc: Staying mobile and drilling lots of holes while chasing roaming bluegills on the ice is the name of the game. Using larger baits like spoons also separates the littles from the Bulls!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Breaking down Lake of the Woods can be tough when in search for big walleyes. But Tyler and Sara may have found a new favorite jig to get the job done!

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself in unfamiliar waters targeting the fish of ten thousand casts.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: After adventuring around the USA Danny decided to compete in a good old fashioned Bass Tournament in his home town.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Father-Son duo Captain’s Hunter & Chris Barron have Sailfish in their sights.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared travels to Venice, Louisiana, where the Mississippi River meets the Gulf, joining Capt. Garrett George and Capt. Jesse Leboeuf for an action-packed offshore adventure in pursuit of Redfish and Tuna.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared joins his best new bud, Capt. Garrett George for a summertime Mahi bash.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Jared's teams up with long time friend and fellow guide, Capt. Greg Dini, to conquer the patch reef.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Key Largo is famous for its vibrant coral reefs that teem with life. So, let’s take a dive and explore this amazing underwater oasis that puts Key Largo on the map! This episode also explores the role of Coralpalooza in coral restoration — and an unexpected hero in seagrass protection: tube socks.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will take you on an incredible journey visiting the most iconic wrecks and reefs in this area of the Keys. And we will also explore the groundbreaking work that scientists and volunteers are working on to shade corals from the harsh sunlight and extreme ocean temperatures.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We are in Marathon, the heart of the Florida Keys, where crystal-clear waters meet charming island vibes. Known for its pristine dive sites, rich marine life, and welcoming locals, Marathon offers some of the best underwater adventures in the world.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Experience the magic of shore diving from one of the Keys’ most scenic beaches. The episode also follows military veterans discovering healing and renewed purpose through diving.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself in unfamiliar waters targeting the fish of ten thousand casts.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: After adventuring around the USA Danny decided to compete in a good old fashioned Bass Tournament in his home town.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Coastal Conservation Association Florida Star Tournament redfish releases.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY. They are checking out some of the damage done to John’s pontoon decking from freezing weather they received. John and the team are upgrading the material, and adding carpeting to the pontoon decking. We also get some information on SPX-Johnson bilge pumps and the ease of access they provide.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We are in Marathon, the heart of the Florida Keys, where crystal-clear waters meet charming island vibes. Known for its pristine dive sites, rich marine life, and welcoming locals, Marathon offers some of the best underwater adventures in the world.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: We are in Kansas again chasing monster whitetails. This season makes 15 years that we have been going to Kansas and this year was special. But first we had to show you this amazing listing in South Louisiana that’s a little different for the Hunting Land Man.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins a local legend in the waters of Amelia Island, exploring its rich fishery and targeting redfish, trout, and more in this coastal gem.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins Capt. Ozzie in Captiva, FL where the action is fast and furious and they chase down an inshore slam in this beautiful Florida fishery.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Capt. Glenn Taylor fish their home waters and pay tribute to dear friend Capt. Billy Nobles.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Sportsmans Journal
programme.desc: Staying mobile and drilling lots of holes while chasing roaming bluegills on the ice is the name of the game. Using larger baits like spoons also separates the littles from the Bulls!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Breaking down Lake of the Woods can be tough when in search for big walleyes. But Tyler and Sara may have found a new favorite jig to get the job done!

programme.desc: Danny finds himself in unfamiliar waters targeting the fish of ten thousand casts.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip

programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Father-Son duo Captain’s Hunter & Chris Barron have Sailfish in their sights.

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Key Largo is famous for its vibrant coral reefs that teem with life. So, let’s take a dive and explore this amazing underwater oasis that puts Key Largo on the map! This episode also explores the role of Coralpalooza in coral restoration — and an unexpected hero in seagrass protection: tube socks.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will take you on an incredible journey visiting the most iconic wrecks and reefs in this area of the Keys. And we will also explore the groundbreaking work that scientists and volunteers are working on to shade corals from the harsh sunlight and extreme ocean temperatures.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We are in Marathon, the heart of the Florida Keys, where crystal-clear waters meet charming island vibes. Known for its pristine dive sites, rich marine life, and welcoming locals, Marathon offers some of the best underwater adventures in the world.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Experience the magic of shore diving from one of the Keys’ most scenic beaches. The episode also follows military veterans discovering healing and renewed purpose through diving.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself in unfamiliar waters targeting the fish of ten thousand casts.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY. We also get some information on SPX-Johnson bilge pumps and the ease of access they provide.

All they need to do is to dig an underground tunnel from China's house to the cemetery next door.

programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: A stranded group of six Allied soldiers trek across the desert, making their way to an abandoned fort, but are soon faced with a German battalion.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Beyond the Sacramento
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) and Cannonball (Dub Taylor) save Lodestone from swindlers preparing a bond scam.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: City for Conquest
programme.desc: A driver risks his sight when he boxes to pay for his brother's education.

programme.title: A Guy Named Joe
programme.desc: A bomber pilot goes to heaven and becomes guardian angel to another pilot.

programme.title: The In-Laws (1979)
programme.desc: The father of the groom drags the bride's father into madcap adventures.

programme.title: Logan's Run
programme.desc: In a dystopian world where people face mandatory death at the age of 30, an elite police officer is tasked with hunting down those who try to escape.

programme.title: Time After Time
programme.desc: When Jack the Ripper steals his time machine, H.G. Wells tracks him down.

programme.title: The Lusty Men
programme.desc: A faded rodeo star mentors a younger rider but falls for his wife.

programme.title: Tom Horn
programme.desc: Steve McQueen stars as a legendary American as untamed as the Old West.

programme.title: Lone Star
programme.desc: A frontiersman helps out with Texas's fight for independence from Mexico.

programme.title: The Nun's Story
programme.desc: A nun cannot maintain her vow of peace when Nazis murder her father.

programme.title: The Office Wife
programme.desc: A gold-digging secretary sets out to lure her boss from his straying wife.

programme.title: The Rise and Fall of Legs Diamond
programme.desc: In Prohibition-era New York, ferocious mobster Jack "Legs" Diamond rises through the underworld ranks, but learns he's no match for a deceitful woman.

programme.title: They Won't Believe Me
programme.desc: A faithless husband is charged with a murder he didn't commit.

programme.title: Souls For Sale
programme.desc: In 19th-century Chinatown, adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A biography of a man who is unjustly convicted of murder, gets locked up in French Guiana, and devotes his life to escaping from prison.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When the members of a family are found murdered at their dining room table, the team looks for secrets in their past; Hotch tries to make peace with his father-in-law (Ed Asner).

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When three alleged murderers claim that they were attacked by a monster at the moment of the crimes, the BAU searches for a suspect who controls minds; the hunt puts one team member in danger.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU tracks a vigilante in Los Angeles who is shooting people with possible ties to criminal activity.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team suspects Kate's niece and her friend were kidnapped by an online predator involved in sex trafficking and race to find them before they are hurt.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU interviews candidates to take the opening left by Kate's departure; the team tracks a serial killer who leaves behind evidence that indicates a person intent on revenge.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team must find the person responsible for a sarin gas attack on a Los Angeles bus before a larger incident occurs.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team suspects a jilted unknown subject is responsible when brides are murdered on the eve of their nuptials.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a robbery-homicide leaves three restaurant employees dead, a cold case that occurred in the same town six years earlier could yield a lead.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A notorious street artist becomes a suspect when corpses are used in macabre graffiti art in Detroit; Dr. Lewis tries to balance work and her relationship with her fiance.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A murder in a Florida community of sex offenders results in a large number of possible suspects; a career opportunity could take Lewis away from the BAU.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Rossi's daughter, a journalist, investigates the disappearance of a college student; JJ comes back from maternity leave.

programme.desc: Chance Bowman (Lucky Vanous) helps a black preacher and his family when their church is burned. With Billy Dee Williams and G. Gordon Liddy.

programme.desc: Chance and Cie follow Henry Conners, tired of being in the witness protection program, to Las Vegas.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: A crime lord joins forces with Chance against Jacob Calder.

programme.desc: Chance Bowman investigates a deadly cigarette smuggling ring.

programme.title: Scorpion

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team members set aside their personal and romantic issues when hackers take over targeted U.S. military aircraft and war ships, pointing the weaponry at American cities.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth suspect bullying as a factor in the death of a private high school student.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: A world-famous DJ is found dead after playing at Mallorca's most popular nightclub.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: A famous anti-bullfighting campaigner is murdered.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files
programme.desc: A fugitive on Mallorca's most wanted list returns to the island to visit his dying father.

programme.title: The Mallorca Files

programme.desc: The team look at a case in which a suburban housewife was killed in a car crash.

programme.desc: The team investigate the death of Joe Walsh, general secretary of the Grand Drivers Union.

programme.desc: When a serial dog killer starts stalking local parks, the team take on the case.

programme.desc: The team goes after vicious criminal Chopper Hadley.

programme.desc: The team struggle with the occult when trying to solve the death of a lonely librarian.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Louisiana, Shelby and his assistant Bob go out looking for logs on his repaired swamp buggy; In Central Florida, the Chapman crew goes to fight against the legendary Gump log.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes to Lake Ponchartrain with Belinda and Bob to obtain a huge log he marked years ago; In Florida, it's round two for the Chapman and Gump log; things go from bad to worse for the bare bones Rygaard crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaards go old school to keep the team on track; Shelby and Bob find a valuable sinker cypress; the Zitterkopf crew tries to take on a dangerous tangle of logs known as "the teepee of death."

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, the Papac team struggles to find someone to fill the shoes of injured Coatsy; Gabe Rygaard and his crew scramble to make up for their slow start; In Wyoming, David Zitterkopf and Sons keep their chainsaws humming.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, Papac initiates an extremely dangerous process called Shotgun Logging; in Wyoming, the Zitterkopf men take the Bear Ranch site by storm; at Rygaard, the team doubles the yarders to increase production.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby uses an airboat to search for century-old logs; Rygaard attempts to move a six-ton cypress; David's sons hold down the fort while he delivers a load of logs to the mill; the Dreadknots suffer a late-day accident.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries to repair his custom-made buggy; David Zitterkopf makes a dangerous swing between trees; the Dreadknots go logging in the night; Triack is at a disadvantage when a crew member is injured.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Louisiana, Shelby and his assistant Bob go out looking for logs on his repaired swamp buggy; In Central Florida, the Chapman crew goes to fight against the legendary Gump log.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes to Lake Ponchartrain with Belinda and Bob to obtain a huge log he marked years ago; In Florida, it's round two for the Chapman and Gump log; things go from bad to worse for the bare bones Rygaard crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaards go old school to keep the team on track; Shelby and Bob find a valuable sinker cypress; the Zitterkopf crew tries to take on a dangerous tangle of logs known as "the teepee of death."

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In the Louisiana Bayou, Shelby Stanga's jet boat is in serious need of repair; in Washington, Gabe takes a risk and hires a wild card veteran logger; in Alaska, the Papac team is battling the elements mother nature is throwing their way.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga attempts to upgrade his logging empire, so he tries out some new equipment; DJ Jeremiah just may provide the spark the Rygaard has been missing; Triack's production is slowing down because of steep terrain and narrow logging roads.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard logging has started to claw its way back up the log count thanks to DJ Jeremiah, but today he's a no show; In Alaska they need to fill the seat in the yarder soon; Shelby Stanga is still without his Jetboat.

programme.desc: Shelby Stanga still doesn't have his jet boat, but fortunately he has his trusty assistant Davi; the Papac crew is struggling to remain atop the King of the Mountain leaderboard, they're moving to the toughest section on their site.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers

programme.desc: Rick and Hugh continue their marathon run, but the Winter Roads wreak havoc on the trucks leaving Hugh stuck on the side of the road.

programme.desc: As the season reaches the halfway point, drivers are desperate to pull ahead in the dash for the cash.
